p: The highest morbi-mortality of COVID-19 is observed among older patients ( 4). Patients in intensive care unit (ICU) are older than patients not requiring ICU ( 5). In a study using an observational database from 169 hospitals in Asia, Europe, and North America, an age of more than 65 years-old was associated with a higher risk of in-hospital death: 10.0% mortality rates for people â‰¥ 65 years-old vs. 4.9% for those < 65 years-old ( 6). In France, 3.6% of infected individuals needed to be hospitalized, with an average death rate of 0.7% ranging from 0.001% in individuals < 20 years-old, to 10.1% in those > 80 years-old ( 7).
